result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Roy Anthony Trotter was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant must be confined for 3 years before eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy Anthony Trotter

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roy Anthony Trotter in court and by Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Resolution reached with defense free to argue.  State takes no position on fine amount.  Upon a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Character reference letters/materials
